intro: Secamone caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed secamone, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
